hierarchy.description: The legal order of the Empire is organized by authority and scope. Lower instruments may not conflict with higher instruments.

sections.title: Rights & Protections
sections.text: Rights are set out in the Imperial Basic Charter. Limitations must be grounded in law and be proportionate.
sections.code: IBC 1921 — equality before the law • due process • fair trial • property protections

sections.title: Courts & Enforcement
sections.text: Tiered courts (local, regional, supreme) and a professional constabulary. Criminal penalties require lawful judgment.

items.title: Acts
items.note: Enacted by Imperial Parliament and promulgated via the Imperial Gazette.

items.title: Decrees and regulations
items.note: Must cite enabling authority and are published in the Gazette.

items.title: Constitutional amendments
items.note: Require a supermajority and imperial ratification.

amendments.entry: Unless otherwise specified, instruments enter into force upon Gazette publication.
